problem.p: Using the same Howe Truss designed in Finding 1; which member, of those listed below, has the highest force in the truss?

choicegroup.label: Which member, of those listed below, has the highest force in the truss?

problem.p: Which member, of those listed below, has the lowest force in the truss?

choicegroup.label: which member, of those listed below, has the lowest force in the truss?

div.p: Positive and negative numbers signify the type of force. A compressive force is a negative number and a tensile force is a positive number. A negative number does not mean it's a smaller force, it only means it's a compressive force. As an example we can look at members AC and BD. AC shows a 75kN force and BD shows a -75kN force. They are both the same amount of force, 75kN, and AC is tensile force (positive number) and BD is a compressive force (negative number).
